column4: My cups (Ubuntu 8.10) seems to "cache" the printer status. When I go from work to home with my laptop, it keeps saying "printer not reachable" for my home printer (which is connected to my server running cups).
Do any of you know if there is a way to set "always check" or something?
When I try to "find" a printer, it recognizes it. I just "worked around" it by messing up the configuration and then fixing it.
i guess if all else fails, you could restart cups, but that's a fairly ugly solution. there's no timeout then? even after waiting five or ten minutes after connecting to the new network?
I'm at home now for about 1 hour.
Last message was for you ( busy here..)
i got it, thanks. kind of odd behaviour; one assumes the cups folks wouldn't let a problem like that go. does the printer show as unavailable even in the cups web interface?

the status on my server is OK (when I "discover" the printer of connect to my server using the gnome tools, the printer is "available"). On my local machine (laptop) I don't have the web interface I guess (stock install ... not checked but doesn't make sense, will check now)
whaa, I have the web interface :)
The printers at my work are "available", as is my home printer (after that kicking of my cups I just did)
does it work the other way? when you go to work, are the printers immediately available?
To be clear, the printers at my work should not be available here, I currently don't have a VPN set up...
I just work there for 2 weeks now... I guess they are.
But I haven't seem them as unavailable
I'll do a test page to the work printer and see what cups does

according to the web interface the work printer is now "processing, accepting jobs" after I send a print. I just get a balloon thing on my desktop telling me the printer is not connected. Web interface status does not change.
hmm. you might try asking in ##cups, see if anyone there has a better idea of what the problem might be.
Ok, thanks... I'll do that later when I have a little more time... I have an apointment in an hour and I have to do some other things first.. Thanks for helping!
